# identifier

**Instance Property**

A unique string identifying the HealthKit object type.

## Declaration

```swift
var identifier: String { get }
```

## Discussion

Each object type has a unique identifier. The identifiers can be grouped into different categories: [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKCategoryTypeIdentifier], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKCharacteristicTypeIdentifier], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKCorrelationTypeIdentifier], and [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKDocumentTypeIdentifier] Each group of identifiers is associated with a different concrete subclass of `HKObjectType`.

## Getting property data

- **requiresPerObjectAuthorization()**: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the data type requires per-object authorization.
